plantuml_diagram:
@startuml
!define AWSPuml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/awslabs/aws-icons-for-plantuml/v20.0/dist
!include AWSPuml/AWSCommon.puml

title NestJS API on AWS App Runner with MySQL and CI/CD

skinparam shadowing false
skinparam componentStyle rectangle
skinparam wrapWidth 220
skinparam maxMessageSize 120

actor "Client" as client

cloud "AWS" as aws {
  node "AWS App Runner\nService" as apprunner {
    artifact "Container Image\nNode.js + NestJS (TypeScript)\nExpress adapter\nListens :3000" as api
  }

  node "Relational Database" as dbnode {
    database "MySQL\n(mysql2 + TypeORM)" as mysql
  }

  node "Amazon ECR\nContainer Registry" as ecr {
    artifact "API Image Repository" as ecrrepo
  }
}

node "GitHub" as github {
  node "GitHub Actions\nCI/CD Workflow" as gha {
    artifact "Build & Test\n(jest/ts-jest, supertest)" as tests
    artifact "Docker Build & Push" as buildpush
    artifact "Deploy to App Runner" as deploy
  }
}

client --> api : HTTPS requests
api --> mysql : TypeORM over TCP 3306

gha --> tests
gha --> buildpush
buildpush --> ecrrepo : docker push

deploy --> apprunner : update service
apprunner --> ecrrepo : pull image

note right of api
Runtime:
- Node.js container
- NestJS v10
- Express platform
- Port 3000
end note

note right of gha
Pipeline:
- Trigger on push/PR
- Login to ECR
- Push image
- Deploy via amazon-app-runner-deploy
end note

@enduml

architecture_description:
## High-level deployment architecture

### Runtime / serving path
- **Client (external users/systems)** sends **HTTPS** requests to the application.
- **API Service (NestJS on Node.js)**
  - Deployed as a **Docker container** to **AWS App Runner**.
  - Built with **TypeScript**, using **NestJS v10** with the **Express** platform adapter.
  - Exposes the web/API endpoint and listens on **port 3000**.
- **Relational Database (MySQL)**
  - The API connects to MySQL using **TypeORM** with the **mysql2** driver over **TCP 3306**.
  - In local/dev, this is represented in `docker-compose.yaml`; in production it maps to a managed or provisioned MySQL instance.

### Container build, registry, and deployment (CI/CD)
- **GitHub Actions CI/CD**
  - Runs build and automated tests (e.g., **jest/ts-jest**, **supertest**).
  - Builds the Docker image from the repository **Dockerfile**.
  - Authenticates to **Amazon ECR** and **pushes** the image.
  - Triggers deployment to **AWS App Runner** (workflow uses `awslabs/amazon-app-runner-deploy`).
- **Amazon ECR** stores the versioned container images.
- **AWS App Runner** pulls the latest image from ECR and updates the running service.

### Key relationships
- Client → App Runner service (HTTPS)
- App Runner (NestJS container) → MySQL (TypeORM/mysql2)
- GitHub Actions → ECR (push image)
- App Runner → ECR (pull image)
- GitHub Actions → App Runner (deploy/update service)
